<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
<P ID=PARA2378 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2379 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2380 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2381 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<P ID=PARA2381 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Note 1 &#8211; Business Description
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2382 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2383 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	CVD Equipment Corporation and its subsidiaries (the &#8220;Company&#8221;), a New York corporation, was organized and commenced operations in October 1982. Its principal business activities include the manufacturing of chemical vapor deposition equipment, customized gas control systems, the manufacturing of process equipment suitable for the synthesis of a variety of one-dimensional nanostructures and nanomaterials and a line of furnaces, all of which are used primarily to produce semiconductors and other electronic components. The Company engages in business throughout the United States and internationally.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2384 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA2384 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2385 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2385 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<P ID=PARA2385 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Note 2 - Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2386 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2387 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Principles of Consolidation
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2388 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2389 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The consolidated financial statements include the accounts of CVD Equipment Corporation and its wholly owned subsidiaries. In December 1998, a subsidiary, Stainless Design Concepts, Ltd., was formed as a New York Corporation. In April 1999, this subsidiary was merged into CVD Equipment Corporation. The Company has two wholly owned subsidiaries: CVD Materials Corporation, which provides marketing for our Application Laboratory and FAE Holdings 411519R, LLC, a real estate holding company whose sole asset is its interest in the real estate and building housing our corporate headquarters. All significant intercompany accounts and transactions have been eliminated in consolidation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2390 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2391 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Use of Estimates
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2392 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2393 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The preparation of financial statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting period. Actual results could differ from those estimates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2394 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2395 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company&#8217;s significant estimates are the accounting for certain items such as revenues on long-term contracts recognized on the percentage-of-completion method, depreciation and amortization, valuation of inventories at the lower of cost or market; allowance for doubtful accounts receivable; valuation allowances for deferred tax assets, impairment considerations of long-lived assets and stock-based compensation and costs associated with product warranties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2396 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2397 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Revenue Recognition
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2398 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2399 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Product and service sales, including those based on time and materials type contracts, are recognized when persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists, product delivery has occurred or services have been rendered, pricing is fixed or determinable, and collection is reasonably
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	assured. Service sales, principally representing repair, maintenance and engineering activities are recognized over the contractual period or as services are rendered.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3708.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK3708 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR3708 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM3708 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-6
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage57"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR3708 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA3708.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2402 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	CVD EQUIPMENT CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIAR
</B>
<B>
	IES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2403 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2404 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2405 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2406 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Note 2 - Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</B>
<B>
	(continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2409 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2410 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Revenues from fixed price contracts are recognized on the percentage of completion method, measured on the basis of incurred costs to estimated total costs for each contract. This &#8220;cost to cost&#8221; method is used because management considers it to be the best available measure of progress on these contracts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2411 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2412 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Contract costs include all direct material and labor costs and those indirect costs related to contract performance, such as indirect labor, supplies, tools, repairs and depreciation costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2413 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2414 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Provisions for estimated losses on uncompleted contracts are made in the period in which such losses are determined. Changes in job performance, job conditions, and estimated profitability, and final contract settlements may result in revisions to costs and income and are recognized in the period in which the revisions are determined.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2415 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2416 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The asset &#8220;Costs and estimated earnings in excess of billings on contracts in progress&#8221; represents gross revenues recognized in excess of amounts billed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2417 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2418 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The liability &#8220;Billing in excess of costs and estimated earnings on contracts in progress&#8221; represents gross amounts billed in excess of revenues recognized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2419 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2420 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Inventories
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2421 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2422 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Inventories are valued at the lower of cost (determined on the first-in, first-out method) or market.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2423 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2424 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Income Taxes
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2425 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2426 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Deferred tax assets and liabilities are determined based on the estimated future tax effects of temporary differences between the financial statements and tax bases of assets and liabilities, as measured by using the future enacted tax rates. Deferred tax expense (benefit) is the result of changes in the deferred tax assets and liabilities. The Company records a valuation allowance against deferred tax assets when it is more likely than not that future tax benefits will not be utilized based on a lack of sufficient positive evidence.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2427 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2428 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Investment tax credits are accounted for by the flow-through method, reducing income taxes currently payable and the provision for income taxes in the period the assets giving rise to such credits are placed in service. To the extent such credits are not currently utilized on the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Company&#8217;s tax return, deferred tax assets, subject to considerations about the need for a valuation allowance, are recognized for the carryforward amount.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3709.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK3709 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR3709 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM3709 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-7
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage58"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR3709 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA2429 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2430 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	CVD EQUIPMENT CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIAR
</B>
<B>
	IES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2431 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2432 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2433 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2434 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Note 2 - Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</B>
<B>
	(continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2437 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2438 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company recognizes the tax benefit from an uncertain tax position only if it is more-likely-than-not that the tax position will be sustained on examination by taxing authorities, based on the technical merits of the position. The tax benefits recognized in the financial statements from such
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	a position are measured based on the largest benefit that has a greater than 50% likelihood of being realized upon ultimate settlement. The accounting guidance on accounting for uncertainty in income taxes also addresses derecognition, classification, interest and penalties on income taxes, and accounting in interim periods. The Company does not believe it has any uncertain tax positions through the year ending December 31, 2015 which would have a material impact on the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2440 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2441 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company and its subsidiaries file combined income tax returns in the U.S. Federal and New York State jurisdiction. In addition, the parent company files standalone tax returns in California, Michigan, Minnesota, New Hampshire and Wisconsin. The Company is no longer subject to U.S. federal and state income tax examinations for tax periods before 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2442 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2443 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company recognizes interest and penalties accrued related to unrecognized tax benefits, if any, in its income tax provision. The Company had no interest and penalties accrued at December 31, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2444 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2445 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Long Lived Assets
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2446 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2447 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Long-lived assets consist primarily of property, plant and equipment. Long-lived assets are reviewed for impairment whenever events or circumstances indicate their carrying value may not be recoverable. When such events or circumstances arise, an estimate of the future undiscounted cash flows produced by the asset, or the appropriate grouping of assets, is compared to the asset&#8217;s carrying value to determine if impairment exists pursuant to the requirements of the Financial Accounting Standards Board (&#8220;FASB&#8221;) Accounting Standards Codification (&#8220;ASC&#8221;) 360-10-35, &#8220;Impairment or Disposal of Long-Lived Assets.&#8221; If the asset is determined to be impaired, the impairment loss is measured on the excess of its carrying value over its fair value. Assets to be disposed of are reported at the lower of their carrying value or net realizable value. The Company had no recorded impairment charges in the consolidated statement of operations during each of the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3710.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK3710 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR3710 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM3710 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-8
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage59"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR3710 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA3710.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2453 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	CVD EQUIPMENT CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIAR
</B>
<B>
	IES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2454 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2455 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2456 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2457 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Note 2 - Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</B>
<B>
	(continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2458 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2459 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Construction in Progress
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2460 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Construction in progress consists of amounts expended for renovating the facility which was purchased on March 15, 2012. Expenditures for maintenance and repairs are charged to operations as incurred; additions, renewals and betterments are capitalized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2461 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2462 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Computer Software
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2463 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2464 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company follows ASC 350-40, &#8220;Internal Use Software.&#8221; This standard requires certain direct development costs associated with internal-use software to be capitalized including external direct costs of material and services and payroll costs for employees devoting time to the software projects. These costs totaled $21,000 and $25,000 for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively, and are included in Other Assets. All computer software is amortized using the straight-line method over its estimated useful life of three to five years. Amortization expense related to computer software totaled $16,000 and $11,000 for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2465 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2466 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Intangible Assets
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2467 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2468 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The cost of intangible assets is being amortized on a straight-line basis over their estimated initial useful lives which ranged from 5 to 20 years. Amortization expense recorded by the Company in 2015 and 2014 totaled $24,000 and $20,000, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2469 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2470 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Research &amp; Development
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2471 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2472 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Research and development costs are expensed as incurred. In 2012 we expanded our laboratory staff and began conducting research and development independentof customer orders. In 2015 we incurred approximately $1,727,000 of research and development expenses of which $570,000 were independent of external customer orders compared to 2014, when we incurred approximately $1,555,000 of research and development expenses of which approximately $878,000 were independent of external customer orders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2473 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2474 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Accounts Receivable
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2475 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2476 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Accounts receivable is presented net of an allowance for doubtful accounts of $19,000 and $24,000 as of December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The allowance is based on historical experience and management&#8217;s evaluation of the collectability of accounts receivable. Management believes the allowance is adequate. However, future estimates may fluctuate based
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	on changes in economic and customer conditions. The Company doesn&#8217;t require collateral from its customers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3711.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK3711 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR3711 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM3711 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-9
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage60"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR3711 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA3711.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2480 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	CVD EQUIPMENT CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIAR
</B>
<B>
	IES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2481 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2482 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2483 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2484 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Note 2 - Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</B>
<B>
	(continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2485 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2488 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Product Warranty
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2489 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2490 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company records warranty costs as incurred and does not provide for possible future costs. Management estimates such costs are immaterial, based on historical experience. However, it is reasonably possible that this estimate may differ in future periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2491 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2492 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Earnings Per Share
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2493 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2494 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Basic earnings per common share is computed by dividing the net income by the weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding during each period. When applicable, diluted earnings per common share is determined using the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding during the period, adjusted for the dilutive effect of common stock equivalents, consisting of shares that might be adjusted upon exercise of common stock options and warrants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2495 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2496 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Potential common shares issued are calculated using the treasury stock method, which recognizes the use of proceeds that could be obtained upon the exercise of options and warrants in computing diluted earnings per share. It assumes that any proceeds would be used to purchase common stock at the average market price of the common stock during the period.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2497 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2498 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Cash and Cash Equivalents
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2499 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2500 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company considers all highly liquid financial instruments purchased with an original maturity of three months or less at the date of purchase to be cash equivalents. The Company had cash and cash equivalents of $13.7 million and $12.0 million respectively at December 31, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2501 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2502 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Concentration of Credit Risk
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2503 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2504 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Financial instruments that potentially subject the Company to concentrations of credit risk consist primarily of cash, cash equivalents, and accounts receivable. The Company places its cash equivalents with high credit-quality financial institutions and invests its excess cash primarily in money market instruments. The Company has established guidelines relative to credit ratings and maturities that seek to maintain stability and liquidity. The Company sells products and services to various companies across several industries in the ordinary course of business. The Company routinely assesses the financial strength of its customers and maintains allowances for anticipated losses based upon historical experience.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3712.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK3712 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR3712 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM3712 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-10
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage61"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR3712 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA3712.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2507 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	CVD EQUIPMENT CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIAR
</B>
<B>
	IES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2508 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2509 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2510 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2511 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Note 2 - Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</B>
<B>
	(continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2512 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2513 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Fair value of Financial Instruments
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2514 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2515 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The carrying amounts of financial instruments including cash and cash equivalents, accounts receivable, net, accounts payable and accrued expenses, deferred revenue and customer deposits approximate fair
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2516 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2517 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Note 2 - Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</B>
<B>
	(continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2518 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2519 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	value due to the relatively short-term maturity of these instruments. The carrying value of long-term debt approximates fair value based on prevailing borrowing rates currently available for loans with similar terms and maturities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2520 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2521 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Stock-Based Compensation
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2522 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2523 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company records stock-based compensation in accordance with the provisions set forth in ASC 718, &#8220;Stock Compensation&#8221; using the modified prospective method. ASC 718 requires companies to recognize the cost of employee services received in exchange for awards of equity instruments based upon the grant date fair value of those awards.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2524 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2525 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Shipping and Handling
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2526 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2527 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	It is the Company&#8217;s policy to include freight charges billed to customers in total revenue. The amount included in revenue was $57,000 and $35,000 for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2528 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2529 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Recently
</U>
<U>
	Adopt
</U>
<U>
	ed
</U>
<U>
</U>
<U>
	Accounting Pronouncement
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<U>
</U>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P ID=PARA3946 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	In May 2014, The Financial Accounting Standards Board (&#8220;FASB&#8221;) issued Accounting Standards Update (&#8220;ASU&#8221;) No. 2014-09, &#8220;Revenue from Contracts with Customers&#8221; (Topic 606), which changes the criteria for recognizing revenue. The standard requires an entity which recognizes revenue to depict the transfer of promised goods or services to customers in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services. The standard requires a five-step process for recognizing revenues including identifying the contract with the customer, identifying the performance obligations in the contract, determining the transaction prices, allocating the transaction price to the performance obligations in the contract, and recognizing revenue when (or as) the entity satisfies a performance obligation. Publicly-traded companies were initially required to adopt the ASU for reporting periods beginning after December 15, 2016; however, the FASB, in August 2015, then issued Accounting Standards Update (&#8220;ASU&#8221;) No. 2015-14 to defer the effective date of ASU 2014-09 for all entities by one year. Currently companies may choose among different transition alternatives. Management is currently evaluating the impact that ASU 2014-09 will have on the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements and have not yet determined which method of adoption will be selected.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3939 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3940 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	In April 2015, the FASB issued ASU No. 2015-03, &#8220;Interest-imputation of interest (Subtopic 835-30): Simplifying the Presentation of Debt Issuance Costs&#8221;, which requires that debt issuance costs be presented in the balance sheet as a direct deduction from the carrying amount of the related debt liability, rather than as a deferred charge asset. ASU No. 2015-03 is effective for the Company beginning January 1, 2016 and is to be applied retroactively. Management is currently evaluating the effect that this ASU will have on the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements and related disclosures.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2541 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2541 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>

<P ID=PARA2558 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

<P ID=PARA2559 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

<B>
	Note 2 -&nbsp; Summary of Significant Accounting Policies (continued)

<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
	We believe there is no additional new accounting guidance adopted, but not yet effective that is relevant to the readers of our financial statements. However, there are numerous new proposals under development which, if and when enacted, may have a significant impact on our financial reporting.
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	CVD EQUIPMENT CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIAR
</B>
<B>
	IES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2821 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2822 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2823 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2824 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<P ID=PARA2824 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Note
</B>
<B>
	7
</B>
<B>
	&#8211; Financing Arrangements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2825 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2826 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On September 3, 2015, the Company extended our existing revolving credit facility with HSBC Bank, USA, N.A. (&#8220;HSBC&#8221;), which was due to expire, until September 1, 2018 under the same terms. The original loan agreement with HSBC was entered into on August 5, 2011, and provided the Company with credit up to $9.1 million consisting of a $7 million revolving credit facility and a five (5) year term loan in the initial principal amount of $2.1 million. The balances on the term loan as of December 31, 2015 and December 31, 2014 were $280,000 and $700,000 respectively. Interest on the unpaid $280,000 principal balance on this term loan accrues at either (i) the London Interbank Offered Rate (&#8220;LIBOR&#8221;) plus 1.75% or (ii) the bank&#8217;s prime rate minus 0.50%. The credit agreement also contains certain financial covenants. As of December 31, 2015, we were compliance with the terms of the covenants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2827 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2828 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Pursuant to the terms of an Accommodation Agreement, we entered into a loan agreement with HSBC in the amount of $6,000,000, the proceeds of which were used to finance apportion of the purchase price of our headquarters. The Loan is secured by a mortgage against our Central Islip facility. The loan is payable in 120 consecutive equal monthly installments of principal of $25,000 plus interest thereon and a a final balloon payment of $3.0 million. Interest accrues on the Loan, at our option, at the variable rate of LIBOR plus 1.75% which was 1.9455% and 1.9108% at December 31, 2015 and 2014 respectively. The balance on the mortgage at December 31, 2015 and December 31, 2014 was $3,565,508 and $3,865,508 respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3732.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA3732.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">

</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK3732 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">

	$2,100,000 5 year term loan payable in monthly installments of $35,000 plus interest on the unpaid principal balance which accrues at a fixed rate of 3.045%. This term loan was secured by $1 million, provided that, so long as no event of default occurred and is then continuing, HSBC would release $200,000 of the collateral on each anniversary of the closing date. As of December 31, 2015, HSBC had released $800,000, to reduce the collateral to $200,000.

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2940 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Stock options to purchase 259,730 shares of common stock were outstanding and 159,730 were exercisable at December 31, 2015. At December 31, 2015 all outstanding options were included in the diluted earnings per share calculation because the average market price was higher than the exercise price. At December 31, 2014 none of the outstanding options were included in the diluted earnings per share calculation as their effect would have been anti-dilutive.
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA2940 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2941 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2942 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Note 1
</B>
<B>
	0
</B>
<B>
	&#8211; Income Taxes
</B>
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
<P ID=PARA2943 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3947 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	At December 31, 2015, the Company had approximately $27,000 in capital loss carryforwards, and $1,134,000 of federal research and development tax credits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3943 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3944 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	If not utilized, the investment tax credits expire from 2016 through 2030 and the research and development tax credits expire from 2030-2035. Based on the available objective evidence, including the Company&#8217;s history of taxable income and the character of that income, management believes it is more likely than not that these components of the Company&#8217;s deferred tax assets will be fully utilized. The Company has provided for a partial valuation allowance against its total net deferred tax assets at December 31, 2015 and December 31, 2014 of approximately $475,000 attributable to these components.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3745.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P ID=PARA2994 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2995 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	In March 2014, New York State eliminated the state income tax for qualified manufacturing companies such as CVD. Due to this change in tax law, the Company was required to write off state-level deferred tax assets which would have been used to offset future taxes payable to New York State.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The tax effects of temporary differences giving rise to significant portions of the net deferred taxes are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA2996 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

	&nbsp;

<P ID=PARA3109 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On June 15, 1989, the Company instituted a non-qualified stock option plan (the &#8220;Plan&#8221;). In connection therewith, 700,000 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock were reserved for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	issuance pursuant to options granted under the Plan through June 30, 2009. All options granted vested over a four-year period and expire between five to seven years after the date of grant. This 1989 Non-Qualified Stock Option Plan expired in June 2009.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3111 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3112 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	2001 Non-Qualified Stock Option Plan
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3113 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3114 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	In November 2006, the Company registered a non-qualified stock option plan that the shareholders had approved in July 2001, covering key employees, officers, directors and other persons that may be considered as service providers to the Company. Options were awarded by the Board of Directors or by a committee appointed by the Board. Under the plan, an aggregate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	of 300,000 shares of Company common stock, $.01 par value, were reserved for issuance or transfer upon the exercise of options which were granted. Unless otherwise provided in the option agreement, options granted under the plan would vest over a four year period commencing one year from the anniversary date of the grant. The stock option plan expired on July 22, 2011.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3747.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

	CVD EQUI
</B>
<B>

<P ID=PARA3120 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">

<P ID=PARA3121 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3122 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3123 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	NOTE 1
</B>
<B>
	1 &#8211; Stockholders&#8217; equity (continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3124 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3125 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	2007 Share Incentive Plan
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3126 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3127 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On December 12, 2007, shareholders approved the Company&#8217;s 2007 Share Incentive Plan (&#8220;Incentive Plan&#8221;), in connection therewith, 750,000 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock are reserved for issuance pursuant to options or restricted stock that may be granted under the Share
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Incentive Plan through December 12, 2017. In 2014, 42,320 shares of stock were granted and issued to directors and key employees, additionally, options were granted to a key employee for 100,000 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock. In 2015, 36,108 shares of stock were granted and issued to directors and key employees.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3129 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3948 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The purchase price of the common stock under each option plan shall be determined by the Committee, provided, however, that such purchase price shall not be less than the fair market value of the shares on the date such option is granted. The stock options generally expire seven to ten years after the date of grant. The Company recorded stock-based compensation of $750,758 and $515,933 for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3132 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3133 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	A summary of the stock option activity related to the 1989 and 2001 Stock Option Plans and the 2007 Share Incentive Plan for the period from January 1, 2014 through December 31, 2015 is as follows:
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Beginning
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The total fair value of shares of restricted stock awards vested for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014 was approximately $170,000 and $135,000 respectively.
</FONT>

</FONT>

<P ID=PARA3433 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The fair value of the outstanding restricted stock awards will be recorded as stock compensation expense over the vesting period. As of December 31, 2015 there was $44,000 of unrecognized compensation costs related to restricted stock awards, which is to be recognized over a period of 0.35 years.
</FONT>

</FONT>

<P ID=PARA3475 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The fair value of the outstanding restricted stock units will be recorded as stock compensation expense over the vesting period. As of December 31, 2015, there was $1,187,000 of total unrecognized compensation costs related to restricted stock units, which is expected to be recognized over a weighted-average period of 1.53 years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3478 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

	During the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, the Company recorded into selling and general administrative expense approximately $751,000 and $516,000 for the cost of employee and director services received in exchange for equity instruments based on the grant-date fair value of those instruments in accordance with the provisions of ASC 718.
</FONT>
</P>

</B>
<B>

</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3485 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3486 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3487 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3488 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<P ID=PARA3488 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	NOTE 1
</B>
<B>
	2 &#8211; Defined Contribution Plan
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3489 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3490 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On August 1, 1998, the Company adopted a 401(k) Plan for the benefit of all eligible employees. All employees as of the effective date of the 401(k) Plan became eligible. An employee who became employed after August 1, 1998 would become a participant after three months of continuous service.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3491 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3492 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Participants may elect to contribute from their compensation any amount up to the maximum deferral allowed by the Internal Revenue Code. Employer contributions are optional. During the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, the Company incurred administrative costs totaling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	$3,080 and $2,800, respectively. No discretionary employer contribution has been made for 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA3492 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3494 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3495 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<P ID=PARA3495 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Note 1
</B>
<B>
	3
</B>
<B>
	&#8211;
</B>
<B>
	Significant Risks and Uncertainties
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3496 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3497 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Cash
</U>
<U>
	and Cash Equivalents
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3498 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3499 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company places most of its temporary cash investments with financial institutions, which from time to time may exceed the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation limit. The amount at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	risk at December 31, 2015 and at December 31, 2014 was $11,966,000 and $10,216,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3501 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3502 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Sales Concentrations
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3503 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3504 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Revenue to a single customer in any one year can exceed 10.0% of our total sales. One customer represented 49.6% and 50.2% respectively, of our annual revenues in fiscal years 2015 and 2014. Another customer represented 13.7% of our revenue in 2015.&nbsp;The loss of current key customers would have to be replaced by others, and our inability to do so may have a material adverse effect on our business and financial condition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3505 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3506 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Export sales to unaffiliated customers represented approximately 9.0% and 20.2% of sales for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. Export sales in both 2015 and 2014 were primarily to customers in Europe and Asia. All contracts are denominated in U.S. dollars. The Company does not enter into any foreign exchange contracts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3752.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA3752.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">

<B>
	CVD EQUI
</B>
<B>
	PMENT CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>

<P ID=PARA3515 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3516 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 9PT 0PT 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3517 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 9PT 0PT 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3518 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<P ID=PARA3518 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Note 1
</B>
<B>
	4
</B>
<B>
	&#8211; Segment Reporting
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3519 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3520 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 9PT 0PT 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company adopted ASC 280, &#8220;Segment Reporting.&#8221; The Company operates through (2) segments, CVD and SDC. The CVD division is utilized for silicon, silicon germanium, silicon carbide and gallium arsenide processes. SDC is the Company&#8217;s ultra-high purity manufacturing division in Saugerties, New York. The accounting policies of CVD and SDC are the same as those described in the summary of significant accounting policies (see Note 2). The Company evaluates performance based on several factors, of which the primary financial measure is earnings before taxes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3521 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3522 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">

</FONT>
</P>

<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<P ID=PARA3626 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Note 15
</B>
<B>
	- Commitments and Contingencies
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3627 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3628 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<U>
	Legal Proceedings
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3629 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3630 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Effective as of January 29, 2015, the Company entered into a Settlement Agreement with Taiwan Glass International Corporation ("Taiwan Glass") and Capital One, National Association ("Capital One") regarding the previously disclosed action in the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York.&nbsp; Pursuant to the terms of the Settlement Agreement, the Company paid Taiwan Glass the sum of $4,925,000, (inclusive of interest) and all claims and counterclaims asserted in the Action were settled and dismissed with prejudice.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3631 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3632 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On September 4, 2015, the Company entered into a Settlement Agreement and Mutual General Release with Development Specialists, Inc., solely in its capacity as Assignee for the benefit of creditors of CM Manufacturing, Inc. f/k/a/ Stion Corporation ("DSI") regarding both the Arbitration proceeding which had been previously filed against it by DSI and the companion Delaware Court of Chancery Court action which had been filed by CVD.&nbsp; Pursuant to the Settlement Agreement, CVD paid the sum of $995,000 to DSI, and each party released all claims of any nature which it had against the other. The parties also executed and filed stipulations of dismissal with prejudice, of both the Arbitration and the Chancery Action.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	F-27

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
